title: Komets open camp on 2015-16 season Monday
text:
Komets open camp on 2015-16 season Monday 
By Komets October 5, 2015 Updated Oct 5, 2015 at 6:57 PM EDT 
Fort Wayne, Ind. (21Alive) -- The Komets opened training camp for their 64th anniversary season Monday at the Allen County War Memorial Coliseum. 
Gary Graham enters his third season as Head Coach of the Komets. Graham launched his camp with 28 players on the preseason roster and has enlisted the services of Konstantin Shafranov as assistant coach for the second consecutive full season. Camp will be held at the Coliseum with the first practice session scheduled for 3pm-5pm Monday.

Camp will held for two weeks and includes three exhibition games. The Komets will skate at Indy Wednesday, Oct. 7 in a preseason match against the Fuel at 6pm at the Indiana Farmers Coliseum. The Komets will host two exhibition games against the Evansville IceMen Friday, Oct. 9 at 8pm and Saturday, Oct. 10 at 7:30pm. The camp schedule is listed below. 
2015-16 marks the Komets' fourth season as a member of the ECHL. The Komets will be seated in the Midwest Division of the 28-team circuit with Indiana rivals Evansville and Indy along with Cincinnati and Quad City. The ECHL will be divided into six total divisions. In addition to the Midwest Division, the Central Division and West Division make up the Western Conference while the North, East and South divisions are in the Eastern Conference. 
Earlier this summer the Komets and the NHL's Colorado Avalanche announced a renewed affiliation with a new two-year agreement covering 2015-16 and 2016-17. The Komets and the San Antonio Rampage of the AHL will serve as affiliates of the Avalanche. Last year San Antonio captured the West Division title in the AHL's Western Conference while setting franchise records of wins, goals and points in a season.
